questions.question: Which is the most popular JavaScript framework?
options: Angular
React
Svelte
Vue

questions.question: Which company invented React?
options: Google
Apple
Netflix
Facebook

questions.question: What's the fundamental building block of React apps?
options: Components
Blocks
Elements
Effects

questions.question: What's the name of the syntax we use to describe the UI in React components?
options: FBJ
Babel
JSX

questions.question: How does data flow naturally in React apps?
options: From parents to children
From children to parents
Both ways
The developer decides

questions.question: How to pass data into a child component?
options: State
Props
PropTypes
Parameters

questions.question: When to use derived state?
options: Whenever the state should not trigger a re-render
Whenever the state can be synchronized with an effect
Whenever the state should be accessible to all components
Whenever the state can be computed from another state variable

questions.question: What triggers a UI re-render in React?
options: Running an effect
Passing props
Updating state
Adding event listeners to DOM elements

questions.question: When do we directly "touch" the DOM in React?
options: When we need to listen to an event
When we need to change the UI
When we need to add styles
Almost never

questions.question: In what situation do we use a callback to update state?
options: When updating the state will be slow
When the updated state is very data-intensive
When the state update should happen faster
When the new state depends on the previous state

questions.question: If we pass a function to useState, when will that function be called?
options: On each re-render
Each time we update the state
Only on the initial render
The first time we update the state

questions.question: Which hook to use for an API request on the component's initial render?
options: useState
useEffect
useRef
useReducer

questions.question: Which variables should go into the useEffect dependency array?
options: Usually none
All our state variables
All state and props referenced in the effect
All variables needed for clean up

questions.question: An effect will always run on the initial render.
options: True
It depends on the dependency array
False
In depends on the code in the effect

questions.question: When will an effect run if it doesn't have a dependency array?
options: Only when the component mounts
Only when the component unmounts
The first time the component re-renders
Each time the component is re-rendered

questions.question: What is a PureComponent in React used for?
options: Handling asynchronous operations
Optimizing rendering performance
Managing state in class components
Styling React components

questions.question: What is the purpose of React Router?
options: Managing server-side logic
Managing API requests
Handling forms and user input
Enabling navigation in single-page applications

questions.question: What is JSX in React?
options: A JavaScript package manager
A syntax extension for JavaScript
A server-side rendering framework
A build tool for React applications

questions.question: What is the purpose of ReactDOM in React?
options: Managing state in React components
Rendering React components to the DOM
Handling API requests in React
Creating reusable React components

questions.question: What does the 'key' prop in React help with?
options: Styling React components
Optimizing component rendering performance
Handling user input in forms
Managing state in class components

questions.question: What is a React fragment?
options: A JavaScript package manager
A build tool for React applications
A way to group multiple React elements without adding extra nodes to the DOM
A component for rendering text

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'key' prop in React lists?
options: It specifies the position of an element in the list
It uniquely identifies elements in a list and helps React optimize updates
It defines the styling for list items
It adds a unique class name to list items

questions.question: What is the role of the 'ref' attribute in React?
options: It defines the order of rendering for components
It references a DOM element or React component created in the render method
It specifies the default props for a component
It manages the component's state

questions.question: Which lifecycle method is used to fetch data in a class component?
options: render
componentDidMount
componentWillUnmount
constructor

options: It calls the component's render method
It initializes the component's state
It calls the constructor of the parent class
It adds event listeners to the component
